results.title: Wait until dark
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Mel Ferrer and Terence Young
results.brief_description: Susy is an independent and resourceful housewife learning to cope with her blindness resulted from a recent accident. Susy’s life changes drastically when she is terrorised by a group of criminals who believe she is in possession of a doll used by them to smuggle drugs into the country. Alone and cut off from the world outside, Susy must fight for her life against this group of ruthless criminals. Music by Henry Mancini. Cast includes: Audrey Hepburn, Alan Arkin, Richard Crenna, Eferm Zimbalist Jr. and Jack Weston.

results.title: Wages of fear = Salaire de peur
results.creator_credit: Vera Films, CICC, Filmsonor (Paris), Fono Roma, Raymond Borderie, Henri-Georges Clouzot and Louis Wipf
results.brief_description: This film runs along the traditional template of any story - a beginning, which unhurriedly and deliberately sets the scene, a middle section that carries the plotline, and a brief ending that resolves everything to no one’s satisfaction. The beginning paints a picture of a world unimaginable to anyone from a developed country, of corruption, poverty, and oppression. It simultaneously describes the main characters - a bunch of immigrants who have strayed to this miserable little town, and for whom there is little chance of escape from the baking heat and unemployment. There is Mario, the happy-go-lucky scrounger, Luigi, his hard-working Italian pal, the comically tyranical tavern owner, his much abused maid, and Jo, the suave and dangerous French gangster. Homosexuality, racism, and the oppression of women figure prominently, but are never commented upon directly, as various prison motifs are evident in the lighting and set construction. Suddenly there is a change - a way out for a ‘lucky’ four of the deadbeats. There has been an explosion at an oil well on the other side of the mountain. The oil company needs to put out the fire with explosives, which are stored in the town. But its nitro-glycerine, and there is no time to get specially-fitted trucks to carry it over the rough mountains roads. Rather than risk their own employees, the oil company offers a large reward to four volunteers. Cue the action as first the men compete for the places on the two trucks, then as the winners embark on their terrifying journey, where every bump could spell instant death. On the journey their true characters emerge. One, Jo, is broken by the ordeal, but is eventually redeemed. ‘How exciting could a simple road trip be?’ you might ask, but the one and a half hour screen journey is petrifyingly spellbinding. Fate seems to be stacked against these bedraggled heroes, but it is their ingenuity, effort and bravery which captures our hearts. In French and Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Wag the dog
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Barry Levinson, Robert De Niro and Jane Rosenthal
results.brief_description: Two weeks prior to re-election, the President of the United States becomes involved in a sex scandal concerning a Girl Scout in the Oval Office. To keep the media from learning of this, Presidential adviser, Winifred Ames, brings in political consultant and spin doctor, Conrad Brean, a specialist in salvage operations. They both join forces with Hollywood producer, Stanley Moss, and in an attempt to divert the country’s attention away from the President, they redirect the media spotlight to a war. Lacking a real war, they create one. Cast includes: Dustin Hoffman, Robert De Niro, Anne Heche, Woody Harrelson, Denis Leary and Willie Nelson.

results.title: Voyage of the damned
results.creator_credit: Associated General Films, Robert Fryer and Stuart Rosenberg
results.brief_description: A gripping, moving film with an all star cast and based on the book by Gordon Thomas and Max Morgan-Witts. It is the tragic tale of 937 German Jewish refugees who left Nazi Germany in 1939 on a ship bound for Cuba. The voyage was part of a propaganda exercise by Goebbels who had arranged that the ship would not be allowed to dock in Havana. As the ship headed towards the United States, President Roosevelt denied entry to the ship. A return to Hamburg would mean certain death in the concentration camps, a fate which the passengers resolved to prevent.

results.title: Voodoo woman
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP), Alex Gordon and Edward Cahn
results.brief_description: A mad scientist, residing deep in the jungle, uses the natives’ voodoo for his experiments to create an indestructible monster. It all goes horribly wrong when he creates a hideous-looking female monstrosity who will not yield to his command. Trading on the themes of mercenary greed and manipulative behaviour, Edward L. Cahn presents an intriguing mix of morally dubious characters whose avarice see them meeting suitably sticky ends.

results.title: Volcano: an inquiry into the life and death of Malcolm Lowry
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Donald Brittain, Robert Duncan, James de B. Domville and John Kramer
results.brief_description: Author of one of the major novels of the century, Under the Volcano, Malcolm Lowry fought a winning battle with words, and a losing battle with liquor. On-location shooting in four countries, photographs, readings by Richard Burton from Lowry’s novel, and interviews with the people who loved and hated him give the film a terrifying immediacy. More than a portrait, it is a reflection on the greater agony of man. (10 awards including: Asolo; Toronto; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)

results.title: Viva Zapata! [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: This dramatisation of the role of the peasant leader Emilio Zapata in the Mexican Revolution was the product of a close collaboration between screenwriter John Steinbeck and director Elia Kazan. Zapata (played by Marlon Brando), an ambiguous historical figure, is idealised in the film yet a certain psychological complexity is maintained. He is a symbolic figure, a ‘natural’ leader who is attuned to the essential needs of the people. Revolution thus becomes a natural rather than a revolutionary process. The weak idealist, Madero, cannot make the revolution work. The shadowy figure of Fernando, the advisor, stands as a symbol for Stalinism. Cast also includes Jean Peters, Anthony Quinn, Joseph Wiseman and Arnold Moss.

results.title: Viva Las Vegas = Love in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and George Sidney
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley stars as racing car driver Lucky Jackson, a man determined to win the Las Vegas Grand Prix and triumph over his number one competitor, Count Elmo Mancini (Cesare Danova). The Count is like Lucky in many respects, a determined, thrillseeking ladies man, which makes defeating him even more difficult. To finance his vehicular obsession (and to purchase the most important item - the engine), he performs as a singing waiter, thus giving Elvis the chance to demonstrate his crooning and hip swinging capabilities. The task proves harder than first thought due to the distraction of sexy swimming instructor Rusty Martin (Ann-Margaret), as Lucky faces the prospect of losing love as well as the race. Elvis’ fourteenth movie includes hits such as “The Lady loves me”, “What’d I say”, “C’mon everybody” and “Viva Las Vegas”. Cast also includes Cesare Danova, William Demarest and Nicky Blair. Contains the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Viridiana
results.creator_credit: Uninci, Films 59, Gustavo Alatriste, Ricardo Munoz Suay and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description: A novice about to take her vows, who has been abused and cheated by her uncle and his illegitimate son, opens up the former’s house to a collection of cripples and beggars. A savage attack on Catholic mentality and rituals, this powerful psychological study was Bunuel’s first film made in his native Spain for over twenty-five years and his last for many more. Although the script had been unaccountably passed by Franco’s censors, the film itself was banned outright in Spain. The notorious set-piece of ‘The Last Supper’ being enacted by social outcasts also caused the Vatican to condemn it. Cast includes Silvia Pinal, Fernando Rey and Francisco Rabal. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Violent Cop = Sono otoko kyobo ni tsuki (D)
results.creator_credit: Shochiku-Fuji Co, Bandai Visual Company, Kazuyoshi Okuyama and Takeshi Kitano
results.brief_description: Takeshi Kitano’s aptly named “Violent cop” is a sadistic and offbeat exercise in screen violence. Expected comparisons to the gleeful revenge soaked fantasies and moral righteousness of the Dirty Harry series are quickly dissipated by Kitano’s deadpan, morally ambiguous protagonist and the unexpected comic moments sandwiched between the painful and bleak depictions of violence. ‘Beat’ Takeshi plays a hardened cop whose special brand of rough justice lands him in bad favor with his supervisors. Things begin to spiral out of control when he tries to help a corrupt colleague who has become involved with the Yakuza. To make matters worse his mentally unstable sister is also lured into the gang, accumulating into the inevitable bloody showdown. In Japanese with English subtitles Cast also includes Maiko Kawakami, Makoto Ashikawa, Shigeru Hiraizumi and Shiro Sano.
